waffleoRai_cafebotCommands

Class BotScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • waffleoRai_cafebotCommands.BotScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class BotScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    A class for bot shift management. This class is responsible for knowing which bot should be covering which "position" (which can be defined as a set of command strings) at any given time. Additionally, a swing timer may be used for automatic shift updating.
    An instance of the BotScheduler class may be referred to when determining which bot is taking a given command at any point in time.

    Optional Background Threads:
    - Shift timer (javax.swing.Timer)
    Instantiated at Construction: Y
    Started at Construction: N

    I/O Options:
    - Permanent Map (plain text)
    - Shift Schedule (plain text)

    Outstanding Issues:
    - Potential inefficient memory use in BotScheduler.Shift
    Since:
    July 1, 2018
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Blythe Hospelhorn

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BotScheduler.DaySchedule
      A wrapper class for an array of shifts for a single day.
      static class  BotScheduler.MonthSchedule
      A wrapper class for a HashMap mapping Day of the Week IDs (int) to DaySchedule type map wrappers, which contain shift information for a given day of the week in that month.
      static class  BotScheduler.PermanentPositionMap
      A wrapper class for a String to Integer HashMap used for mapping command strings to constant bot indices.
      static class  BotScheduler.Position
      A class containing information for a position - a set of command strings which a bot assigned to the position is responsible for as well as a unique index.
      static class  BotScheduler.Shift
      A class containing information for a single shift.

      • DEFAULT_SHIFTS_PER_DAY

        public static final int DEFAULT_SHIFTS_PER_DAY
        The suggested default number of shifts per day. This is set whenever a shifts per day value is required but not provided.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • BotScheduler

        public BotScheduler(int shifts_per_day,
                    java.util.Collection<BotScheduler.Position> positions,
                    int nbots,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> permMap)
        Construct a BotScheduler by generating a new schedule provided the desired number of shifts in a day, the number of bots available (indices must be consecutive), a Collection of the available positions, and a pre-existing command string/bot index map for shift indifferent commands.
        This function does not necessarily assign shifts "fairly." Some bots may end up with a higher number of shifts than others.
        This function will not assign one bot to multiple positions in the same shift.
        Parameters:
        shifts_per_day - Number of shifts desired in a single day. Although the number can be any integer greater than 0, use of very large numbers, especially those that exceed the number of minutes in a day, can lead to undesirable results. Values which would yield a number of even length shifts per day are encouraged (eg. 6).
        positions - A collection of Positions that must be covered for any given shift. If there are more Positions than there are bots, then this constructor will fail. This collection may be empty or null (should all positions be non-shifting).
        nbots - The number of bots available to take any given position during any given shift. This number has no upper limit, but it must be at least 1.
        permMap - A pre-made map of command strings and bot indices indicating which bots should handle which commands at all times, regardless of shift. These assignments take precedence over shift assignments. This map may be empty or null if no permanent assignments are desired.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one or more arguments is outside the valid range.

      • BotScheduler

        public BotScheduler(java.lang.String schedfile,
                    java.lang.String permfile)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    FileBuffer.UnsupportedFileTypeException
        Construct a BotScheduler by loading data from a previously existing BotScheduler off disk.
        Parameters:
        schedfile - Path to the shifting schedule file.
        permfile - Path to the permanent command map file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error accessing either file on disk.
        FileBuffer.UnsupportedFileTypeException - If there is an error parsing either file.

    • Method Detail

      • setParseCore

        public void setParseCore(ParseCore pc)
        Link a ParseCore object to this BotScheduler. This allows the scheduler to issue commands to bots linked to the ParseCore whenever a shift change occurs to update their status messages.
        Parameters:
        pc - ParseCore object to link. May be null if unlinking is desired.

      • getShiftsPerDay

        public int getShiftsPerDay()
        Get the number of shifts in a given day.
        Returns:
        The number of shifts per day used by this scheduler.

      • getAllPositions

        public java.util.Set<BotScheduler.Position> getAllPositions()
        Get a set of all Positions set for the current shift (and all shifts if the scheduler was constructed properly).
        Returns:
        A Set of all positions as BotScheduler.Position objects set for the current shift, or null if no current shift is set.

      • getCommandCount

        public int getCommandCount()
        Get the total number of commands associated with all shifting positions set for the current shift. This method is primarily for the purposes of writing information about this scheduler to disk.
        Returns:
        Total number of commands recognized by current Shift.

      • minutesPerShift

        public static int minutesPerShift(int shifts_per_day)
        Calculate the number of minutes that would be in any given shift (floored) given the number of shifts in a day.
        Parameters:
        shifts_per_day - Hypothetical number of shifts in a day.
        Returns:
        Number of minutes a shift would cover given the number of shifts in a day, rounded down to the nearest whole minute.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • startTimer

        public void startTimer()
        Start the background thread (implemented as a swing Timer) that calls BotScheduler.actionPerformed on approximately every shift change.
        This method will instantiate a new Timer if the current Timer is set to null. It does not, however, check to ensure that this scheduler utilizes shifting positions before starting the Timer.
        There is no point in running the Timer if there are no shifting positions, but it may be done regardless.

      • stopTimer

        public void stopTimer()
        Stop the background timer thread if the Timer object is non-null and is running. This calls Timer.stop(), causing the Timer to stop sending ActionEvents to the scheduler. As a result, shift changes will stop occurring automatically until the Timer is restarted.

      • setCurrentShift

        public void setCurrentShift()
        Check the time, pull the appropriate Shift from the shift map, and set it as the current shift.
        If there is a ParseCore linked, also command all bots connected to the ParseCore to update their status messages in light of the shift change.

      • sendCommandTo

        public int sendCommandTo(java.lang.String commandName)
        Query the scheduler to determine which bot the command correlating to the given string should be sent to.
        Parameters:
        commandName - String representation of the command to send.
        Returns:
        Index, presumably relative to the querying parser core, of the bot to send the command to, or -1 if the command was not recognized.

      • saveSchedule

        public void saveSchedule(java.lang.String diskPathVar,
                         java.lang.String diskPathPerm)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Save this scheduler to disk by writing data to files in plain text format.
        Parameters:
        diskPathVar - Path of file to save shifting position data to.
        diskPathPerm - Path of file to save permanent position data to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error writing either of the requested files.
